title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest adopted No. 55 at USC, following Junior Seau's success, and later wore it with the New England Patriots.
McGinest became the Patriots' second all-time sack leader with No. 55, participating in four Super Bowls and winning three.
Junior Seau joined New England in 2006, asking McGinest for permission to wear No. 55, marking a mutual respect between them.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County reported the highest snow totals, with Salisbury and Beverly each receiving 13 inches in Saturday's storm.
Bristol County saw significant snowfall, including 8.2 inches near Dartmouth and 6.5 inches in Rehoboth.
Moderate snow accumulations in Middlesex County, with Marlborough receiving 7 inches and Winchester 6.2 inches.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC during Super Bowl LX featuring the Patriots and Seahawks.
Tirico will also host NBC's Olympic studio program from Milan, following his Super Bowl LX coverage from Santa Clara.
The broadcast will include analyst Cris Collinsworth and pregame commentators Maria Taylor, Devin McCourty, and Rodney Harrison.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots, under quarterback Drake Maye, are 4.5-point underdogs against the Seahawks for Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara.
The game marks New England's 12th Super Bowl appearance, while Seattle makes its fourth; they previously met in Super Bowl XLIX.
Seattle boasts the top scoring defense; the Patriots have faced teams with top-five defenses throughout the postseason.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel received advice from Bill Belichick and Andy Reid ahead of coaching his first Super Bowl.
Vrabel relied on Patriots offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels's experience, who is participating in his 10th Super Bowl.
Patriots practiced a simulated halftime break, a strategy used by Belichick and Reid in previous Super Bowls.

title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots aim to win a record seventh Super Bowl, breaking a tie with Pittsburgh for the most wins.
Quarterback Drake Maye could become the first second-year quarterback to win a Super Bowl since 2014.
Coach Mike Vrabel seeks to be the first to win a Super Bowl with the same team as a player and coach.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs seeks a Hall of Fame boost with a potential Super Bowl LX win with the New England Patriots.
Diggs has been a four-time Pro Bowler and has two All-Pro nods, but questions remain about Hall of Fame eligibility.
Currently 38th in all-time receiving yards, Diggs believes a Super Bowl victory could distinguish him among peers.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri named to Pro Football Hall of Fame's class of 2026.
Vinatieri won three Super Bowls with the Patriots, contributing vital game-winning kicks.
Scored 2,673 points over 24 NFL seasons with Patriots and Colts, the most in NFL history.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel mimicked a Super Bowl halftime break during the Patriots' final practice to prepare players for a longer intermission.
Patriots players like Drake Maye participated fully in practice, while Harold Landry III and Robert Spillane were limited due to injuries.
Mike Vrabel's practice methods drew inspiration from former coach Bill Belichick, focusing on both preparation and team enjoyment.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Drake Maye and Sam Darnold will face off as starting quarterbacks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium.
Darnold has been turnover-free in the postseason despite high regular-season turnover rates, while Maye has improved after early playoff struggles.
The Patriots and Seahawks are evenly matched, with both ranked high in points scored and fewest points allowed this season.
